item.title: Abandoned vehicle since August 2025, 22nd November
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle since August 2025 blocking the pavement and access to the building, potentially a fire hazard and you do nothing!!! It is unsafe for the residents of the building. If you ignore the problem and there is a fire or explosion of this van Westminster Council will be liable for criminal negligence. Take action ASAP

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Elmfield Way, Kensal Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken latch on bin door, 22nd November
item.description:
The door on the litter bin towards the Walworth Road end of Liverpool Grove, east of the planted area, is always flapping open. I presume that the latch is broken and needs to be fixed or replaced. It's hardly the most urgent problem in the world but it just looks untidy and spoils the spot a bit.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Liverpool Grove, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subject: Urgent Request for Cleaning and Maintenance – Woodsford Building Lifts and Corridors, 22nd November
item.description:
Dear Southwark Council Housing Management, I would like to report ongoing issues in our building (Woodsford) Portland Street London.Both lifts are in very poor condition and have not been cleaned properly for months. The entrance corridors are also not being maintained. Additionally, dogs have been urinating in the lifts, causing a very strong and unpleasant smell, making them difficult to use. Could you please arrange for the lifts and the entrance corridors to be cleaned as soon as possible? Also, could you place a notice reminding pet owners that dogs are not allowed to urinate inside the lifts? Thank you for your attention and prompt action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Scooter abandoned on footpath, 22nd November
item.description:
I’d like to report an abandoned, damaged scooter located on the corner of Blakes Road and Peckham Grove, SE15 6DX. The scooter is broken and in pieces, and it is currently blocking the footpath where elderly residents and children regularly pass. Could you please arrange for its removal at the earliest opportunity?.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 116, Sedgmoor Place, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet more 'oops' tags on green telecoms box, 22nd November
item.description:
Two silver spray tags on the green telecoms unit. This is pretty much a weekly occurrence on this box, so if you have any camera footage from this location you might be able to catch him in the act.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 163, Parish Lane, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Resident has dumped the rubbish from their own property, 22nd November
item.description:
Another resident has decided to take a bag of their own waste and dump it outside of 90-92 Southover -doorbell camera footage. This was dumped approximately Wednesday 19th November 2025

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southover, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
